rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Gentzen's Formalization of the Propositional and Predicate Calculus.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: My purpose in this thesis is to show the merits of the approach of G. Gentzen to the accepted predicate and propositional calculus of logicians today. It will be proved that his formalization is equivalent to the so-called classical approach. The advantages of his system are that his formalization is closer to natural reasoning and that it affords a proof that indirect proofs may be eliminated in the predicate calculus.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Mathematics.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Some Aspects of Islam in Modern Iran, with special reference to the work of Sangalaji and Rashid.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: In Iran, as in other Muslim lands, the need has been felt for a reinterpretation of Islam, which will revive a pure belief both among the masses, whose faith is mingled with superstitions, and among those who have received Western or Western-inspired educations, many of whom have been affected by the spread of scepticism. In recent years, certain thinkers have appeared, from among both the religious leaders and the Western educated intellectuals, who have endeavoured to satisfy that need. The purpose of this thesis is to describe the ideas of some of these thinkers, the greatest of whom, in the writer's opinion, are Sangalaji and Rashid.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Islamic Studies.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: On the motivation of the rat in problem-solving.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: One of the fundamental assumptions of many contemporary psychological theories is that all behavior is motivated by biological drives such as hunger, thirst and sex. Increased attention, however, has been given in recent years to types of behavior which cannot be explained solely in terms of such drives. A number or naturalistic and experimental studies has shown that exteroceptive stimuli may motivate an animal as persistently as any internal homeostatic stimuli. Tinbergen (1951), von Frisch (1950), Lorenz (1950), Thorpe (1944) brought evidence of exteroceptively elicited patterns of behavior from studies on lower animals.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Psychology.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Society in the novels of Joyce Cary.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Society in some sense, is the common birthright of all novelists. But for each writer, the word “society” has some particular meaning that is more precise than any general, all-inclusive definition. Society, for Jane Austen, meant the class-structure of her day and of her country. Nothing outside that concerned here as a novelist. The whole broad and varied expanse of eighteenth-century English life composed the society Henry Fielding depicted. Some novelists are interested primarily in a highly sophisticated and intellectual group of people, others in low life, and others still, in people of many social levels.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: English.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Enzyme studies of mitochondria from barley seedlings.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The respiratory activities of the living organism are of great interest to the physiologist. In the study of respiratory mechanisms in the plant, three main experimental approaches have been employed. Two of these methods have this in common, that they both study the overall gas exchange in plant tissues. The first technique introduces a variable into the respiring system by altering the oxygen tension to which the living tissue is exposed. Different partial pressures of oxygen cause alterations in the respiratory rate of the tissue under investigation, and the interpretation of the results has led to the formulation of schemes of intermediary metabolism.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Botany.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The withering away of the state: from Marx to Stalin.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: In proclaiming its self-dissolution as the goal of its existence the Communist State of the Twentieth Century is unique in history. Unlike other constitutions, especially those framed by newly-established revolutionary regimes, the first constitution of the Soviet Russian Republic, enacted in 1918, is devoid of declarations of sanctity and eternity government and states expressly that "the principal object of constitution of the R.S.F.S.R. which is adapted to the present transition period, consists in the … abolition of exploitation of man by man and the establishment of socialism, under which there shall be neither class division nor state authority."
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Political Science.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Psychosocial aspects of congenital heart disease in children.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Congenital heart disease, so called because the individual is born with a heart that has developed incompletely or abnormally, is found in all age groups. However, its incidence is highest in the childhood years, and it is the children with this diagnosis with whom this study will be concerned. The study will concentrate upon psychosocial factors which affect the care and treatment of the children and their life adjustment. Congenital heart defects have become more prominent in clinical medicine as methods of diagnosis have been improved and new surgical procedures have been developed.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Social Work.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The principle of individualism in Kierkegaard’s philosophy.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Following Kierkegaard's hint respecting the importance of his earlier life, Chapter l of this thesis surveys his childhood and youth with a view to the assessment of its significance for certain important elements in his philosophy and, more specifically, for his understanding of the process of self-realization. The purpose of the historical sketch in Chapter II is to exhibit the continuity of the concern for self-realization or individuation in recorded philosophical and religious reflection.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Philosophy.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: New synthesis of papaveraldine, isoquinoline and related open-chain compounds.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: In the course of a series of investigations in these laboratories on the chemistry of vanillin, attempts were made to improve the synthesis from it of the opium alkaloid papaverine. This alkaloid finds use in medicine as one of a group of spasmolytic drugs with a paralyzing action on the smooth muscles of the intestines and blood vessels. Unlike some of the other opium alkaloids, papaverine is neither narcotic nor habit-forming.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Chemistry.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Topology of the field of p-adic numbers.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The p-adic numbers were introduced by K. Hensel [1] in connection with number theory. The absolute value properties of these numbers were subsequently generalized to the theory of valuations. The p-adic numbers generate a non-archimedean metric space, of which the arithmetic properties were investigated by H. Hasse and F. K. Schmidt [2]. The importance of non-archimedean fields in representation theory creates the need for a theory of functions over these fields. J. Dieudonne' [3] , and F. Loonstra [4] have made initial studies in this domain.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Mathematics.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The planktonic copepods (Calanoida, cyclopoida, monstrilloida) of Ungava Bay, with special reference to the biology of Pseudocalanus minutes and Calanus finmarchicus.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Collections of planktonic copepods of Ungava Bay and central Hudson Strait were made during late June, July and August of 1947, 1949 and 1950. The following twenty-two species have been identified: Calanus finmarchicus, C.hyperboreus, C.helgolandicus, Pseudocalanus minutus , Microcalanus pygmaeus, Gaidius tenuispinus, Aetideopsis rostrata, Pareuchaeta norvegica, P.glacialis, Eurytemora americana, Metridia longa,Pleuromamma robusta, Heterorhabdus norvegicus, Acartia longiremis, A.bifilosa, Oithona similis, Oncaea borealis, Cyc10pina gracilis, C,Schneideri, Monstrilla dubia, M.helgolandica and M,canadensis. The latter five species have not previously been recorded from the western North Atlantic.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Zoology.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Studies on the metabolism of D-glucosamine and N-acetyl-D-glucosamine.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The importance and widespread distribution of the 2-amino sugars has gradually been revealed in investigations during the last 70 years. They are now regarded as important components of a broad group of substances, being present in many compounds of diverse biological function, such as heparin, the bacterial polysaccharides, the polysaccharides of connective tissue and the structural polysaccharides which make up the exoskeleton of many invertebrates. The amino sugars do not normally occur in the freestate, but as compounds of substances of varying complexity.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Biochemistry.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Guidance in democratic education.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: This study is based on the thesis that all education should be liberal in curriculum, method, instruction, and administration. It should mean full development- physical, mental, emotional, and spiritual- of free men guided by free men. Its foundation should be the ideal of all true faiths and of democracy itself, viz, duty towards God, and a Vision of Greatness and duty towards one’s neighbour, as a goal of unselfish service. It should practice Greek philosophy in striving for knowledge as Goodness, found in all true Religion; as Beauty, learned through the Arts; as Truth, found in Science, as well as in Art and Religion.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Education.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The influences of social factors on the autokinetic effect.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: There have been two main types of studies on social influences on perception. The first type of study has not been concerned with social influences on perception per se, but has attempted to discover the personality factors which influence perception. Most of the work in this area has been done by Bruner (4,5,6,7,24) and Postman (6,7, 24,26) and collaboraters. A survey of the literature of this field is contained in the volume by Blake and Ramsey (3).
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Psychology.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Determinative factors in the formation of the logos concept in the Johannine literature with particular reference to the prologue of the Fourth Gospel.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The- present study aims to discover the theological content and background of the term logos as used in the Prologue to the Fourth Gospel. The use of the term was traced through primary sources of possible influence on the Evangelist,-on the Greek side, the fragments of Heracelitus, Plato, Aristotle, and the Iiterary remains of the Stoics from Zeno through Cleanthes. A study was also made of certain key concepts in the mythological tradition.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Divinity.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: On a Hamiltonian treatment of fields with non-local interaction.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The Non-Local Field Theory owe its origin to an attempt made by the physisists to solve the divergence difficulties arising in the Quantum theory of fields. It has often been sugested in recent years that those difficulties could not be solved without modifying the concepts of the conventional field theory for short distances. Since the early days of quantum electrodynamics, it has been clear that an essential part of the divergencies are due to the use of the point-like picture of the elementary particles.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Mathematics.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The trend towards secularism in Turkey as exemplified by its educational development.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: It has been said by many scholars that at the present the Middle East is grappling with the problem of Westernization. For us to comprehend this problem, they say that we must analyze and understand what this process of Westernization is and what it involves. This is true; yet there is a need for a clarification of terms and ideas before one proceeds with such a study. In the first place, what is meant by the term Westernization?
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Islamic Studies.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: A toxin neutralizing substance from penicillium cyaneo fulvum.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: A mould was isolated in this laboratory by Dr. D. G. Denton in 1947 which was found to produce in culture a potent toxin neutralizing substance. The mould was isolated as a contaminant from a Lowenstein's slope which had been inoculated with sputum tor the bacteriological diagnosis of tuberculosis. It was shown that the active toxin neutralizing principle was secreted into the medium during the growth of the mould in fluid cultures and that it may be demonstrated in mycelium free culture filtrates.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Bacteriology.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Studies on the isolation, purification, and determination of enzymes in succulent plants.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Succulent plants are characterized by having leaves that are relatively thick, fleshy, and juicy as compared to herbaceous plants whose leaves are relatively thinner in structure and contain a higher proportion of dry matter. They may be annual or perennial and widely distributed within the families Crassulaceae, Cactaceae, Euphorbiaceae, and to a lesser extent in Asclepiadaceae, Begoniaceae, Liliaceae, and Compositae. They could be classified primarily as xerophytes, and accordingly are found naturally in the arid regions of the world, although ecological adaptation has increased their range considerably.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Botany.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The preparation and analysis of casein low in vitamins of the B-complex.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Research workers who have carried out experiments with animals or birds have sought a protein free from vitamins and having a high biological value. Many workers have used casein for this purpose. The B-vitamins have usually been removed from casein by prolonged extraction with either dilute acid or organic solvents such as ethanol and methanol. Several patents issued for the preparation of low vitamin casein describe extraction procedures with such solvents.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Agricultural Chemistry.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The synthesis of peptide bonds.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: This thesis reports work which is an integral part of a larger project underway in these laboratories under the direction of Dr. R. V. V. Nicholls, the ultimate goal of which is the synthesis of several naturally-occurring oligopeptides with physiological activities. The purpose of the present work is to initiate an investigation of the problems associated with the synthesis of peptide bonds. Two aspects are under consideration here; first, to study the methods by which amine acids can be rendered monofunctional so that their reactions may be strictly controlled; second, to examine amidation reactions from the standpoint of the controlled synthesis of peptide bonds.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Chemistry.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Observations and Comments on the Reaction of Trichinella Spiralis.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The original purpose of this investigation was to trace the migration of the immature Trichinella spiralis larvae from the intestinal tract to the skeletal musculature of the host, in this instance, the golden hamster, Cricetus auratus Waterhouse. The migratory route of the intestinal larvae has been a subject of international zoological debate since 1895, when Askanazy and Cerfontaine independently published refutations of Leuckart's "active migration theory" (1860). [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Parasitology

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Schumpeter's Theory of Long-Run Economic Change: a Study in Economics and Economic Sociology.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Schumpeter's full theory of economic change, the complete "Schumpeterian System", deals both with change in the capitalist system (growth, technological development, cyclical time-shape alteration, and so on) and with change in the capitalist order (broad institutional change within the framework of capitalism and the demise of capitalism itself).
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Economics.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: a Study of Emotionally Disturbed Children of Pre-School Age.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Family casework agencies have always been concerned with the impact of life's circumstance on the family as a whole and with what can be done to help families achieve stability or to make changes that will help them to achieve maximum effectiveness in handling both everyday and critical life problems. In family-centred casework, the improvement of the social functioning of the family unit is achieved by direct or indirect treatment of individual family members, so planned, so balanced and controlled, that benefits accrue to the total group.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Social Work.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: an Investigation into Some Physical Properties of Rocks and their Relationship to Pressure Problems in Mines.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Canada is known throughout the world as one of the fortunate "Have" as contrasted with the less fortunate 'Have not' countries. This is accepted as meaning that, as a country, Canada has been richly endowed with a great variety of high grade mineral deposits. The statement 'Canada has unlimited mineral resources" is encountered time and again in periodicals and the daily press.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Engineering.
